Fun facts

  • Sometimes in the morning when you‚Äôre biking to work, you might find that the air in Amsterdam smells like dark chocolate powder. It‚Äôs most likely the chocolate factory in Zaandam.
  • When I‚Äôm abroad and I smell the scent of weed, I am hit with a bout of strong nostalgia for the city. When I‚Äôm home and I smell it, I feel disdain.

Why Amsterdam works for me

To my surprise, when Dutch people from outside of the city tell me about Amsterdam, they usually assume I‚Äôm here for the culture and proximity to commercial innovation. Having grown up in the South of the Netherlands as a queer person of color, I‚Äôve become intimately familiar with what it means to be The Other. Next to Rotterdam, Amsterdam is the only place in the country that doesn‚Äôt further cultivate that feeling. It‚Äôs been a healing experience for me to call this city home.
